title: Air India to cut international flights on widebody aircraft due to safety inspections
byline: Air India on Wednesday said it has decided to reduce its international services on wide-body aircraft by 15 per cent for the next few weeks.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts.

title: PM Harini on the timely need to address food loss and food insecurity
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya participated in the High-Level Policy Dialogue entitled ‘Beyond Waste: Optimizing Food, Water, and Energy for Better Nutrition in South Asia’ at the ITC Ratnadipa Hotel, Colombo.

title: European ministers to hold nuclear talks with Iran on Friday in Geneva, source says
byline: The foreign ministers of Germany, France and Britain plan to hold nuclear talks with their Iranian counterpart on Friday in Geneva, a German diplomatic source told Reuters.

title: ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ launches program to improve tuk-tuk drivers’ service in tourism sector
byline: The ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ Secretariat has launched a new initiative aimed at improving the attitudes, ethics, and service standards of three-wheeler drivers operating within the tourism sector.

title: Train guards to launch token strike from midnight today
byline: The Lanka Railway Controllers’ Union says it will engage in a 48-hour token strike from midnight today (19), citing several issues, including delays in promotions.

title: Mosquito control week to be implemented across 16 districts
byline: A mosquito control week will be implemented in 16 districts from June 30 to July 5, the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) announced.

title: Iran, Israel trade fresh air attacks as Trump weighs US involvement
byline: Iran and Israel traded further air attacks on Thursday as President Donald Trump kept the world guessing about whether the United States would join Israel’s bombardment of Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake produced before court
byline: Former Minister and Anuradhapura District Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), Duminda Dissanayake, who was remanded in custody, has been brought before the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court today (19).

title: Keheliya’s son-in-law, daughter-in-law, and daughter appear at Bribery Comm.
byline: The son-in-law, daughter-in-law, and another daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today (19).

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until June 26 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in relation to the case filed over the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town, Colombo.

title: Sri Lankan caregiver injured in missile attack near Israeli hospital
byline: A Sri Lankan female caregiver has reportedly been injured following an Iranian missile attack near a hospital in Israel, according to Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Israel, Nimal Bandara.

title: New President and two Judges of Appeals Court sworn in
byline: Senior Additional Solicitor General and President’s Counsel, Mr Nalin Rohantha Abeysooriya, was sworn in this morning (19) as the new President of the Court of Appeal before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Shrinking cloud cover intensifies global heat, study warns
byline: Earth’s cloud cover is shrinking at a rapid pace, intensifying global warming and contributing to record-breaking temperatures worldwide, an international study involving Australian researchers has revealed.

title: Formation of new Beruwala UC delayed after court intervention
byline: The establishment of the new Beruwala Urban Council, which was scheduled to commence today (19), has been temporarily halted, according to a group of councilors of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Keheliya’s two daughters and son-in-law arrested
byline: Two daughters and the son-in-law of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: New Chairman appointed to Colombo Stock Exchange
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) today announced the appointment of Mr. Dimuthu Abeyesekera as the new Chairman of its Board of Directors.

title: Special notice to Sri Lankan nationals in Iran
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism today officially announced that the Sri Lanka Embassy in Tehran has been temporarily relocated to a new address due to the prevailing situation in that country.

title: S’gamuwa Uni student committed suicide due to ragging, preliminary investigations reveal
byline: Preliminary investigations have revealed that a second-year student at the Faculty of Technology of the Sabaragamuwa University committed suicide recently due to ragging, the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has stated.

title: Russia not isolated on international stage: Ex-President Ranil
byline: Despite a prolonged fallout with Europe, the United States and Western nations due to the Ukraine conflict, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe asserts that Russia is not isolated on the international stage and is continuing to work with nations in the Asian region.

title: Keheliya, wife and daughter released from custody after fulfilling bail conditions
byline: Former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife Kusum Priyadarshini Epa and a daughter have been released on bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court after fulfilling bail conditions.

title: Railway strike temporarily called off
byline: The Lanka Railway Controllers’ Union has decided to temporarily call of the strike action which was scheduled to be launched from midnight today (19).

title: Sri Lanka has underinvested in higher education and research for decades: PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that Sri Lanka’s strong educational foundation has not translated into a leading, innovative, sustainable, resilient state or society, as the country has underinvested in higher education and research for decades.

title: Keheliya’s two daughters and son-in-law granted bail
byline: Two daughters and the son-in-law of former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella, who were arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) earlier today, have been granted bail.

title: Kandy Esala Perahera to commence on July 25
byline: The Sri Dalada Esala Perahera of the Scared Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy is scheduled to commence on July 25.

title: Code of Criminal Procedure (Amendment) Bill signed into law
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has signed the Code of Criminal Procedure (Amendment) Bill into law, the Department of Communication of Parliament stated.

title: SJB’s Manjula Senaviratne elected Chairman of Aranayaka PS, Deputy Chairman from Sarvajana Balaya
byline: Manjula Senaviratne of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya was today (19) elected as the Chairman of the Aranayake Pradeshiya Sabha after securing 16 votes.

title: Malaysia obtains local court order against Telegram for allegedly spreading harmful content
byline: Malaysia’s communications regulator said on Thursday it has obtained a temporary court order against messaging service Telegram and two channels on the platform for allegedly disseminating content that violates the country’s law.

title: German lab tests reveal substandard immunoglobulin vials contained harmful bacteria
byline: Court was today (19) informed that the controversial “substandard immunoglobulin vials” which caused widespread controversy in the country, contained harmful and highly dangerous types of bacteria and salt for the human body.

title: Iran’s leader should ‘no longer exist’ - Israel defence minister
byline: Israel’s defence minister Israel Katz has said Iran’s supreme leader, Ali Khamenei, “can no longer be allowed to exist” after the Soroka hospital was hit during an Iranian missile attack, according to local media and the AFP news agency.

title: One of Keheliya’s daughters remanded after failing to fulfill bail conditions
byline: One of the daughters of former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella who was granted bail earlier today, has been ordered to be remanded after failing to fulfill the bail conditions, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka-Bangladesh FTA?
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Arun Hemachandra has expressed Sri Lanka’s interest in strengthening relations with Bangladesh’s private sector.

title: Kumana entrance of Yala National Park to open tomorrow for Kataragama pilgrimage season
byline: The Kumana entrance, located on the eastern side of the Yala National Park is scheduled to be opened tomorrow (20) in preparation for the 2025 Kataragama pilgrimage season.

title: Police investigation underway over assets of 28 politicians
byline: An investigation has been initiated regarding the assets of 28 politicians, including current Members of Parliament and prominent ministers of the previous government by the Illegal Property or Assets Investigation Division of the Police Department.

title: UN rights chief: Israel-Iran hostilities inflict severe civilian harm
byline: The large-scale attacks carried out by Israel across Iran, along with missile and drone strikes launched by Iran in response, have caused serious human rights and humanitarian impacts on civilians and risk igniting a broader regional conflict, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk said in a statement issued on Thursday.
